Secure .gov websites use HTTPS A lock ( Lock A locked padlock ) or https:// means you’ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites. Resources About EDGAR Home Submit Filings About EDGAR About EDGAR April 23, 2024 What is EDGAR? EDGAR,&nbsp;the Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval system,&nbsp;is the primary system for&nbsp;companies and others submitting documents under the Securities Act of 1933, the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Trust Indenture Act of 1939, and the Investment Company Act of 1940.&nbsp; Containing millions of company and individual filings, EDGAR benefits investors, corporations, and the U.S. economy overall by increasing the efficiency, transparency, and fairness of the securities markets. The system processes about 4,700 filings per day, serves up 3,000 terabytes of data to the public annually, and accommodates 40,000 new filers per year on average.&nbsp; Learn about the&nbsp; history of EDGAR . EDGAR® and EDGARLink® are registered trademarks of the SEC. Who has access to EDGAR’s information? Access to EDGAR’s&nbsp; public database &nbsp;is free—allowing you to research, for example, a&nbsp;public company’s&nbsp;financial information and operations by reviewing the filings the company makes with the SEC.&nbsp;You can also research information provided by&nbsp;mutual funds (including&nbsp;money market funds),&nbsp;exchange-traded funds (ETFs), variable annuities, and individuals. The Office of Investor Education and Assistance has created a helpful guide to&nbsp; Using EDGAR to Research Investments . What resources are available to help you file in EDGAR? EDGAR provides a wealth of resources to help filers, including: How to apply for EDGAR access ; Website support for EDGAR filers ; and Telephone support for EDGAR filers . Who administers EDGAR? The&nbsp; EDGAR Business Office (EBO) &nbsp;is the business owner of EDGAR. The office’s responsibilities include: Governance and administration of EDGAR; Strategic planning for EDGAR; EDGAR filer support; and Support for SEC staff with rulemaking and other development in EDGAR Last Reviewed or Updated: Nov. 28, 2025 Return to top SEC homepage About the SEC Budget &amp; Performance Careers Commission Votes Contact Contracts Transparency Accessibility &amp; Disability Artificial Intelligence Cummings Notice FOIA Inspector General No FEAR Act Data Ombuds SEC Excess Personal Property Guidance Websites Investor.gov Related Sites USA.gov Site Information Plain Writing Privacy &amp; Security Site Map Stay connected.
